label: Nov 20 – 21, 1963 · Dallas, TX
title: The Ralph Leon Yates incident
description: Ralph Leon Yates reported picking up a hitchhiker on Nov 20, but FBI alibi checks suggest the event likely occurred on Nov 21. Both dates are preserved here for analysis of potential Oswald movements.

label: Late Sept 1963 · Dallas, TX
title: The Sylvia Odio Incident
description: Sylvia Odio reported that three men, including one identified as 'Leon Oswald', visited her home in Dallas to seek support for the anti-Castro cause. The visit allegedly occurred while Oswald was purportedly elsewhere.

label: April 10, 1963 · Dallas, TX
title: The Walker Incident
description: An assassination attempt is made on General Edwin Walker at his home. A bullet is fired through his window, narrowly missing him. The Warren Commission later concluded Lee Harvey Oswald was the shooter.

label: Oct 16, 1963 · Dallas, TX
title: Oswald Hired at TSBD
description: Lee Harvey Oswald begins work at the Texas School Book Depository (TSBD) as an order filler earning $1.25 per hour. The job referral came from Ruth Paine's neighbor.

label: Nov 26, 1963 · Dallas, TX
title: First Yates Report
description: Ralph Leon Yates voluntarily contacts the Dallas FBI office to report picking up a hitchhiker he believes was Lee Harvey Oswald carrying a package of 'curtain rods'.

label: Nov 27, 1963 · Dallas FBI Office
title: Formal FBI Interview
description: Yates appears at the FBI office with his uncle, J.O. Smith. He details the hitchhiker's questions about shooting the President from a window. Agents Arthur Carter and C. Ray Hall conduct the interview.

label: Dec 10, 1963 · Dallas, TX
title: Signed Statement & Photo ID
description: Yates provides a sworn affidavit to SA C. Ray Hall. He positively identifies a photo of Oswald. He adds details about the hitchhiker showing him a picture of a man with a rifle.

label: Jan 3, 1964 · Dallas, TX
title: Alibi Verification Check
description: FBI Agents re-interview Yates regarding discrepancies in his service call timeline. They confront him with the lack of a check stub from Charlie's Meat Market.

label: Jan 4, 1964 · Dallas, TX
title: Polygraph Examination
description: Yates submits to a polygraph test administered by the FBI. The results are recorded as 'inconclusive' with no significant deception indicated.

label: Jan 8, 1964 · Late Night
title: Distressed Phone Call
description: Yates calls SA C. Ray Hall late at night, crying and emotionally upset. He returns the next morning (Jan 9) to discuss his family's history of mental illness.

label: Jan 15, 1964 · Dallas FBI Office
title: Final Appearance & Hospitalization
description: Yates appears with his wife, carrying pills he claims his doctors are using to kill him. Following this visit, he is admitted to Woodlawn Hospital for psychiatric observation.
